results.title: Longing for belonging
results.creator_credit: Jane Harrison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jane Harrison’s search for belonging is a road trip with a lot of potholes along the way. Of mixed descent, she has longed to connect with her Indigenous heritage, which has forced her to confront some issues and attitudes within Australian society today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Harrison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Expand my boundaries
results.creator_credit: Denise VanWyk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When she was given the opportunity to study in Melbourne, Denise VanWyk and her family seized it with both hands. She marvels at her new home, its diversity, acceptance and relaxed atmosphere.

results.title: Cannot wait
results.creator_credit: Deborah Hoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In the memory of her beloved Po Po, Deborah Hoe remembers the time she spent with her grandmother, the visits, the letters and the lessons Hoe has learnt.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2009)
results.brief_description: Seven members of the general public participate in ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. Through the life changing events and tributes to family members, resonates a search for identity and a sense of home.

results.title: The Soul of St Kilda
results.brief_description: Like some other residents, Meyer believes that St Kilda Town Hall is the heart of the community. He takes us through the rich history that is on display on the walls of this great building.
results.description: Like some other residents, Meyer believes that St Kilda Town Hall is the heart of the community. He takes us through the rich history that is on display on the walls of this great building.

results.title: Nihiwatu
results.creator_credit: Christiana Stergiou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: On the remote Indonesian island of Sumba is the village of Nihiwatu, a place that can only be found in the Ethical Travel Guide. It was here that Christiana Stergiou discovered her utopia, and a place that, despite being a seasoned traveller, she will never forget.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christiana Stergiou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: On the remote Indonesian island of Sumba is the village of Nihiwatu, a place that can only be found in the Ethical Travel Guide. It was here that Christiana Stergiou discovered her utopia, and a place that, despite being a seasoned traveller, she will never forget.

results.title: See me
results.brief_description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.
results.description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.

results.title: Allan's "Westella"
results.creator_credit: Bob Barber, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The sad occassion of the sale of the beloved family farm “Westella” gives Bob Barber cause to reflect on the times there. It was at “Westella” that Barber learnt many things about running farm, and where he could always get a feed.

results.title: My first farewell
results.creator_credit: Angela Jones, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Angela Jones recalls a time when her daily activities caused her to feel a sense of shame and self consciousness that she would never like to experience again.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (November 2008)
results.brief_description: These eight Digital Stories were created by members of the general public in Melbourne, Victoria. Mostly concerned with the concept of home, these eight different people provide a variety of perspectives.
